To make beautiful matte gold put in a bit of varnish or greasy oil, not the kind that is made from cleaning brushes but the kind that is made greasy in the sun, or mix with ceruse.
Matte gold of this kind is scarcely less beautiful than the burnished gold and lasts longer in the rain and otherwise, and is made more quickly. Burnished gold cracks with time and is damaged in the rain.
left-top When gold color starts to adhere, this is a sign that in ten or twelve hours it will be dry and ready for gilding.

To prevent the growth of breasts or to diminish ones that are too large
Take large breads fresh from the oven and split them into two parts, and apply them when they are as hot as possible, and do this 3 times a day, and continue 4 or 5 days. Afterwards make a plaster with Venice turpentine, or even better, with common turpentine. Mix it with sumac, sloe from bushes, quince seed, pomegranate flower, and leaves of olive trees, and other things similar, cooked and mixed with turpentine. But I forgot that it is necessary, after having applied the hot bread, which softens and makes you sweat, to apply linens soaked with water from a honeycomb, which is to say honey and beeswax extracted all together from the hive.

To attract pigeons
Make a fricassee in a pan with hempseed oil and give it to the pigeons.
Against the bruising of the eyes
At night, apply on your eyes sheets of very delicate lead. Unique remedy.

Brushes
In order to make them good, cut the hair from the tail of a squirrel, as as much in one take as could be held in a card rolled like a hollow straw. And putting them thus in the aforesaid folded card, tap it and ruffle it so that the hair gathers together and becomes the same length.
